result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey T. Rodrick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:28 AM Defendant Jeffrey T. Rodrick in court.  Attorney Erika Amundson in court for Jeffrey T. Rodrick.  Attorney Trenton John Piltz in court for State of Wisconsin. This is the time and date set for a Competency Hearing. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Parties have reviewed Dr. Minter's report. The report finds the defendant competent. Parties agree with the reports findings. Defendant feels that he is competent to proceed. Court finds that defendant is competent to proceed. 

Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count 2: Possession of THC and Count 4: Resisting an Officer. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant guilty. 

Court orders:
12 month Probation sentence withheld with conditions on each count concurrent.

Conditions of Probation: 
45 days jail on Count 1, Huber granted. All stayed pending further order of the court. 
AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
court costs and surcharges.

Anything else is ordered dismissed and read in. 
2 days of jail credit if revoked from Probation.

Court adjourns competency proceedings for Defendant to obtain county appointed attorney.

Court indicates there is no need for Dr. Minter at this time as the Defendant does not object to the report's findings.
